title: Armies at Waterloo
description:
Armies at Waterloo: A Detailed Analysis of the Armies that Fought History's Greatest Battle


Empire Games Press | 1983 | ISBN: 0913037028 | English | 354 Pages | PDF | 216 MB


 This book provides new archival information on the composition of the French, British, Prussian, Dutch, and other allied armies. It also provides a novel look at the campaign itself by providing a complete set of near-contemporary full color tactical maps together with a clear explanatory text. The combination of detail on the armies and their major combat arms, the discussion of their organization and equipment, combined with maps and the accompanying narrative provide a new look at Waterloo, Wavre, Ligny, and Quartre-Bras, detailed, impartial, and complete. They allow the reader to reconstruct in his own mind the grand tactics of these last battles of the Napoleonic Wars.
